messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Delusional and Paranoid Behavior, was  Digest Number 1454
messages.msgSnippet: Put up or shut up time, Sandra.  Either have your supposed sources stand up and be counted or stuff your bs!  You are good at English, or so you say, so you
messages.messageBody:
Put up or shut up time, Sandra. Either have your supposed sources stand up
and be counted or stuff your bs! You are good at English, or so you say, so
you should know the definition of libel. Also, just in case you didn't
know, being the promulgator of innuendos and gossip is actionable.

I usually ignore you when you stoop yet once again to sophomoric behavior.
Lots of folks think you are a bag of hot air, posturing and strutting around
playing expert and that ignoring you would be the best way to deal with
someone with National Enquirer journalistic proclivities. Twould appear
that they were wrong.

Since you are now attacking others, I will be more than happy to send them
chapter and verse on where you are stepping over the legal line and how to
deal with you. I hope we are real clear on this now.

BTW, you are aware that there is medication for delusional behavior and
paranoia.

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: <SandraDodd@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, September 12, 2001 10:13 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1454


>
> In a message dated 9/12/01 11:03:42 AM, lurine@... writes:
>
> << That isn't an example of dishonesty. that's an example of
> miscommunication.
> AND, she did come back and explain it and people are still harping. In
> fact, she explained it in great depth. I don't have to go back to look,
it
> was about being the only one who could fix it once it was unhooked. They
> know it, she knows it, the whole list knows it if they bothered to read
what
> was written, not what they decided was written. So what's dishonest.
> >>
>
> I think part of what's dishonest is that someone has come onto this list
> without good intent. I've been told that some of these who are so
vehemently > defending questionable stuff are on another list together, so I
wonder (and
> have been asking, in various ways) how much of the recent noise has been
for > the sake of disruption. A kind of social vandalism.
>
> Sandra
>
> Sandra
>
> "Everything counts."
